abstract: HD DVD continues to show some fight in its seemingly unending war with Blu-ray. Meanwhile, LG and Samsung introduce new dual-format players.
snippet: HD DVD continues to show some fight in its seemingly unending war with Blu-ray. Meanwhile, LG and Samsung introduce new dual-format players.
lead_paragraph: The electronics industry has spent billions of dollars on a stupid and unnecessary battle between the next-generation DVD formats: Blu-ray and HD DVD. And so far, it’s all been pretty much for nothing; consumers aren’t touching the things. Nobody wants to risk buying a DVD player that can play only half of the world’s movies.

headline.main: In This War, How to Ally With Both
headline.print_headline: State of the Art: Taking Both Sides In DVD War

abstract: Battered by a downturn in the housing market, the company is laying off 500 workers at its headquarters in Atlanta, or about 10 percent of its work force there.
snippet: Battered by a downturn in the housing market, the company is laying off 500 workers at its headquarters in Atlanta, or about 10 percent of its work force there.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot, battered by a downturn in the housing market, is laying off 500 workers at its headquarters in Atlanta, or about 10 percent of its work force there, the company said.

headline.main: Home Depot Plans Layoffs at Headquarters
